content: loop method at the end of every rs row except row 8 knitting starts here increased stitch is knitted/purled as a twisted stitch on the ws row to avoid a hole on the rs note the row in the charts are read as follows i recommend finishing your scarf width with the purl rs row right to left stitch so the stitch pattern is symmetrical on both ws row left to right sides see chart a row 41 / st 23 in green border all charts have row-by-row transcription if you prefer 3 decreases are done at the end of each rs row text over charts k2tog before 2 edge stitches and are worked until you have 4 sts left on your needles cast on 4 sts 4 the stitch pattern is 4 row and 4 stitches set-up row ws sl1p p2 sl1p 4 sts marked in green box in chart a start knitting chart a and complete all 42 row row 1 is a rs row the sample scarves have different numbers of stitch pattern repeats if you are knitting the smaller scarf you will have green 5 wide x 65 long reached 5 stitch pattern repeats + 1 purl stitch for fuchsia 6 wide x 102 long symmetry by row 41 rs white 8 wide x 79 long there are now 25 sts on the needles 2 edge sts 4 x 5 st pattern repeats 20 sts 1 purl st for symmetry 2 adding/reducing the repeats allows you to make the edge sts desired width and length creating your unique after completing 42 row of chart a you have accessory from a cute little scarf to a wide cosy wrap finished row 2 of the stitch pattern note if you want a wider scarf continue making note a longer and wider scarf will require more yarn increases at the end of every rs row before edge sts until you are happy with your scarf width bescarfed scarf © 2023 marina morozova all rights reserved 2 row 3 and 4 of the stitch pattern need to be worked now to complete the stitch pattern work row 3 and 4 from chart b to complete the full stitch pattern you are ready to knit the body of the scarf now start working according to chart b the green lines separate stitch pattern repeats so you can place stitch markers here for easier stitch pattern following repeat the row 1-4 as many times as you want your scarf length to be after you are happy with your scarf length continue knitting chart c with rs row starting with row 1 of the stitch pattern pay attention to row 41 where the decrease is made at the beginning of the row the knit stitch together with the edge stitch finishing bobble the last 4 sts weave in the ends and wet block to desired measurements leave the scarf flat until completely dry if you would like to share your knits i d
